qas.question: What form of government does Ann Arbor have?
How many voting members are there in the city- council?
How many terms does the mayor of the city serve?
Who is elected every even numbered year?
How many council members are elected for the city's ward?
Who is the current Republican mayor of Ann Arbor?
What administrator manages day to day operations and is chosen by the mayor?
Who was chosen mayor in the last odd numbered year?

context: Ann Arbor has a <a0_0>council-manager<a0_0/> form of government. The City Council has <a1_0>11<a1_0/> voting members: the mayor and 10 city council members. The mayor and city council members serve <a2_0>two-year<a2_0/> terms: the <a3_0>mayor<a3_0/> is elected every even-numbered year, while half of the city council members are up for election annually (five in even-numbered and five in odd-numbered years). <a4_0>Two<a4_0/> council members are elected from each of the city's five wards. The mayor is elected citywide. The mayor is the presiding officer of the City Council and has the power to appoint all Council committee members as well as board and commission members, with the approval of the City Council. The current mayor of Ann Arbor is <b5_0><b7_0>Christopher Taylor<b7_0/><b5_0/>, a Democrat who was elected as mayor in 2014. Day-to-day city operations are managed by a <b6_0>city administrator<b6_0/> chosen by the city council.
